meanings.definition: The state or quality of being monochromatic.
meanings.sent1: Her artwork displayed a beautiful monochromatism, with various shades of blue blending seamlessly.
meanings.sent2: The room was decorated in monochromatism, with all the furniture and walls in shades of white.
meanings.sent3: The fashion designer's obsession with monochromatism led to a wardrobe filled entirely with black clothing.
meanings.sent4: In the artist's eyes, the city was a canvas of monochromatism, each building a stroke of gray.
meanings.sent5: The simplicity of monochromatism in the painting evoked a sense of calm and serenity.

meanings.definition: A condition in which an individual sees everything in shades of a single color.
meanings.sent1: His monochromatism made it challenging to distinguish between objects of similar hues.
meanings.sent2: Living with monochromatism, she perceived the world in endless shades of green.
meanings.sent3: At the costume party, his monochromatism unintentionally turned him into a walking camouflage.
meanings.sent4: Her monochromatism transformed the vibrant garden into a dull sea of red.
meanings.sent5: The artist's monochromatism allowed him to appreciate the subtle variations in the sky's blue.
